value.title: IBM’s Watson Assistant can now field election questions
value.excerpt: IBM is teaming up with states to deploy a Watson Assistant solution that answers questions about the election via phone or online.

value.title: Qualcomm details Cloud AI 100 chipset, announces developer kit
value.excerpt: Qualcomm shared details about the Cloud AI 100 chipset it announced last year, along with the Cloud Edge AI Development Kit.

value.title: How AI can reduce customer service costs by up to 30% (VB Live)
value.excerpt: AI-powered virtual agents and chatbots not only help businesses slash the call center costs, but dramatically improve customer relationships as well.

value.title: Baidu debuts updated AI framework and voice platform, wireless earbuds
value.excerpt: During a virtual keynote to kick off its Baidu World 2020 conference, Baidu announced updates across its AI product portfolio, including new earbuds.

value.title: What are deepfakes? AI that deceives
value.excerpt: Deepfakes extend the idea of video compositing with deep learning to make someone appear to say or do something they didn’t really say or do

value.title: IBM to Leverage Watson, Enhance Fantasy Football Experience
value.excerpt: International Business Machines Corporation IBM will be leveraging the AI capabilities of Watson to enrich ESPN Fantasy Football experience for gamers. IBM unveiled a new feature called Trade Assistant (only for mobile iOS and Android) to help gamers make judicious decisions regarding adding and offloading players from the teams.

value.title: AI ethics groups are repeating one of society’s classic mistakes
value.excerpt: International organizations and corporations are racing to develop global guidelines for the ethical use of artificial intelligence. Declarations, manifestos, and recommendations are flooding the internet.

value.title: Can A.I. solve one of the oldest mysteries of linguistics?
value.excerpt: Lost languages like Linear A have confounded researchers for decades, but as artificial intelligence advances, could technology crack the case?

value.title: Toucan raises $3M to teach you new languages as you browse the web
value.excerpt: Toucan has developed a Chrome browser extension designed for anyone who wants to learn a new language but hasn’t found the motivation or the time. value.title: Bahrain Says It’s Time to Embrace Israel. The Gulf Hears a Saudi Voice.
value.excerpt: Bahrain’s closeness to Saudi rulers makes it unthinkable the change in diplomatic ties happened without approval. But Saudi Arabia itself may not be in a rush to normalize relations with Israel.

value.title: Researchers claim masks muffle speech, but not enough to impede speech recognition
value.excerpt: But masks attenuate speech, which has implications for the accuracy of speech recognition systems like Google Assistant, Alexa, and Siri. In an effort to quantify the degree to which mask ...

value.title: Coronavirus led to world's first 'infodemic,' but AI could be answer
value.excerpt: Two American AI experts have blamed the coronavirus pandemic for an intense flurry of published results of scientific studies.

value.title: ID R&D Voice Biometrics Solutions Now Available on Microsoft Azure Marketplace
value.excerpt: ID R&D has announced that its artificial intelligence-based voice biometrics solutions are now available on the Microsoft Azure Marketplace

value.title: A beginner’s guide to AI: Separating the hype from the reality
value.excerpt: An advanced artificial intelligence created by OpenAI, a company founded by genius billionaire Elon Musk, recently penned an op-ed for The Guardian that was so convincingly human many readers were astounded and frightened.

value.title: Millions of Indians are getting connected to an internet they can’t use
value.excerpt: Most Indian businesses, banks, and government services develop their websites and apps in English and Hindi. What about the users who speak other languages?

value.title: Researchers find cutting-edge language models fall short in basic reasoning
value.excerpt: A new paper finds that even cutting-edge language models like OpenAI's GPT-3 perform poorly when it comes to commonsense reasoning.

value.title: Voice assistants don’t work for kids: The problem with speech recognition in the classroom
value.excerpt: Young "remote learners" often struggle to navigate the keyboards, menus, and interfaces required to make good on the promise of education technology.

value.title: Researchers’ data set pinpoints challenges adapting speech recognition models to new hardware
value.excerpt: Researchers developed a data set -- Libra-Adapt -- designed to show the challenges in adapting voice recognition models to new devices and settings.

value.title: How AI is impacting customer experience in fintech (VB Live)
value.excerpt: Learn how companies like MasterCard are implementing AI and NLP strategies that transform how fintech customer experience is done.

value.title: Microsoft Announces the General Availability of Immersive Reader Service on the Azure AI Platform
value.excerpt: Immersive Reader, which is a part of the Cognitive Services suite within the Microsoft Azure AI Platform, provides help for readers to read and comprehend text. In a recent blog, Microsoft announced the general availability of the service.

value.title: Glaxo’s biology research with novel Cerebras machine shows hardware may change how AI is done
value.excerpt: A novel computer system built by Cerebras Systems of Los Altos, California, is already leading to changes in the way drug giant Glaxo builds large neural nets for drug development.

value.title: We’re entering the AI twilight zone between narrow and general AI
value.excerpt: OpenAI's GPT-3 transcends the definition of narrow AI. It doesn't qualify as general AI, but it's the first clear sign that we've begun the shift.

value.title: Trump plans to collect DNA, eye scans, and voice prints from immigrants
value.excerpt: The Trump administration's plans to expand the collection of biometric data from immigrants would let the government "surveil and target our communities."

value.title: Past The AI Hype: When Is AI Actually Profitable?
value.excerpt: One of the most important value drivers of machine learning and artificial intelligence technology isn't the technology itself. It's where a company deploys it.

value.title: A notorious GPT-3-generated blog shows AI still can’t imitate human writing
value.excerpt: So you’re interested in AI? Then join our online event, TNW2020, where you’ll hear how artificial intelligence is transforming industries and businesses. Last week, many tech publications broke news about a blog generated by artificial intelligence that fooled thousands of users and landed on top of the Hacker News forum.
